intro: Pedicularis rhynchodonta f. maxima, commonly known as the giant monkey orchid, is a striking member of the Orobanchaceae family. It is characterized by its tall, erect stems and large, showy flowers that resemble orchids in appearance. The plant is native to the high altitudes of the Himalayas and is adapted to cold, mountainous environments. Its flowers are typically pink to purple in color and are pollinated by specific insect species. This rare and ornamental plant is valued for its unique morphology and ecological significance in alpine ecosystems.
